text:
Parts of north India continued to reel under an intense cold wave with the mercury plummeting to minus 16.6 degrees Celsius in Kargil even as dense fog engulfed several regions including the national Capital, disrupting train and flight services.

Kargil in Ladakh region of Jammu & Kashmir had recorded a low of minus 14.6 degrees Celsius on Saturday, an official said.

Jammu & Kashmir braces up for more cold as the Meteorological Dept. has said the prevalent dry weather in the Valley is likely to end, while predicting rain or snowfall for few days in next week. Leh was relatively less cold on Sunday, registering a minimum of minus 15.8 degrees Celsius, a slight rise from previous night’s low of minus 16.2 degrees Celsius. - PTI
title: Intense cold, fog in north India
